source_note: State baseline derived from Connecticut DEEP recycling and organics programs; municipal rules may vary.

organics.guidance: Commercial food scraps recycling required under CGS §22a-226e; residential composting encouraged.
organics.notes: Several towns offer curbside or drop-off food scrap collection.

paper_cardboard.guidance: Recycle clean paper and cardboard; flatten boxes before placing in bins.

glass_containers.guidance: Recycle bottles and jars (rinsed, no lids).
provenance: CT DEEP What’s IN, What’s OUT list

metal_containers.guidance: Recycle clean aluminum and steel/tin cans.
metal_containers.notes: No aerosol or paint cans unless empty.

plastics.guidance: Recycle plastic bottles, jugs, and tubs labeled #1–#7; loose, not bagged.
plastics.notes: Plastic bags, film, and foam not accepted curbside.

beverage_containers_crv.guidance: Connecticut has a 10¢ bottle deposit on eligible containers.
beverage_containers_crv.bin: Return to redemption centers or retailers.
beverage_containers_crv.notes: Covers most beverage bottles and cans under 3 liters.

household_batteries.guidance: Recycle rechargeable and lead-acid batteries at collection sites.
household_batteries.notes: Keep batteries out of regular trash.
provenance: CT DEEP Household Hazardous Waste guidelines

e_waste.guidance: State law mandates e-waste recycling under the CT E-Waste Recycling Law.
e_waste.bin: Drop-off at participating town collection sites.
e_waste.notes: Includes TVs, monitors, computers, and printers.

plastic_bags_and_film.guidance: Plastic carryout bags banned statewide since 2021.
plastic_bags_and_film.bin: Return film to retail store drop-offs.

bulky_items.guidance: Bulky waste requires scheduled pickup or drop-off at transfer station.
bulky_items.notes: Fees and policies vary by town.
